general.headline: Founder & Job-Success Coach | Helping Professionals Unleash their Career Potential
general.description:
I wasted 3 years at university trying to get a qualification in IT... 
After racking up a huge student loan in something I didn’t enjoy, I decided I just wanted to work. 

Without a qualification and any career direction, I fell into doing factory work for 5 years. 
The moment when I realised my strengths and passion -- it was HR.

I was able to change the course of my career and have since been in recruitment for over 11 years; placing people in major corporates which include Telstra, Computershare, Exxon Mobil, Foxtel, Link Group, Department of Human Services, Australian Tax Office, NBN, REA Group and many more.
As a Senior Recruiter, my role has always been to find the top 5% of applicants to put forward for jobs -- which meant rejecting a lot of people…

After reading 500,000+ resumes and interviewing 10,000+ people; I saw so many people make the same mistakes again and again.

It wasn’t because they didn’t have the skills, qualifications or attitude; they just didn’t know how to sell themselves. I'm now dedicated his life to coach people about the recruitment blueprint and the hiring psyche so they can get into that top 5%.

Now as a Job-Success Coach, I focus on 3 key areas:

- Mindset: Framing your mind for success
- Personal Brand: Create an image that is valuable to employers
- Hiring Psyche: Understand exactly what employers and recruiters look for 

A regular public speaker at career events and major universities across Australia; I provide insights to all levels of audiences. 

I'm also a Career Mentor for Monash University and Australian National University in Canberra - coaching final year students for success in their career journey.

www.careerists.com.au

jobs.description:
Increase staff engagement by up to 100%, innovation by up to 83%, and profit by up by 50% . Fiona offers bespoke gender equity, diversity & inclusion education, analytical and strategy support services customised to organisation's needs. Our D & I "Generational Impact Model"  and inclusive leader mindset tools together with our innovative  diversity, inclusion, unconscious bias, and workplace respect programs give leaders and practitioners new behaviours, practical actions and a clear roadmap to shift mindsets, systems and make culture change. Specialising in not just "what" but also the "how"  to increase leader and staff buy in, and mobilisation to increase inclusion for everyone.  Services include
1.	Inspirational training in Diversity, inclusion, unconscious bias, inclusive leadership and workplace respect 
2.     Coaching and mentoring that builds  leaders and staff capability to move beyond a tick box compliance D & I approach that  unleash the potential of all staff 
3.      Conducts gender equity and D & I audits and strategy that achieve positive results
4.     As a UK  trained Athena SWAN assessor,  Fiona also provides education and  strategic advice to assist   SAGE (Science in Australia gender equality)  pilot member organisations 

Fiona's clients include  University of Sydney, Australian Federal Police, RANZCO, TransGrid, Macquarie University, Canon Australia & New Zealand,  Bendigo & Adelaide Bank, BHP Coal, QSuper & Consult Australia. Fiona was previously the Director of the Equal Opportunity for Women in the Workplace Agency (1999-2004) where she founded the 'Business Achievement Awards' and 'Women in Leadership Census'. Fiona has more than 20 years of diversity experience in a range of corporate, government and non-for-profit change leadership roles. Fiona has been internal Head of Diversity for University of Sydney, ANZ Banking Corporation, Westpac, Esso Australia and the Victorian Department of Agriculture.

jobs.jobTitle: D & I SAGE Lead & Strategic D & I consultant
jobs.description: In this role Fiona was instrumental in establishing the Athena SWAN Science in Gender Equality (SAGE) pilot initiative at Sydney. She now provides external Athena SWAN and D & I consultancy to the Sydney SAGE Initiative  and also continues to deliver Diversity and Inclusion and Unconscious Bias training to over 650 leaders and staff at the university.

Fiona consulted widely and developed and implemented the highly successful 
- Women's Career Acceleration & leadership Strategy 
- Diversity & Inclusion Strategy that has been integrated into 2016-2020 University Strategic Plan to shift mindsets & culture to deliver a safe, inclusive and welcoming workplace culture at Sydney
- Delivers diversity & inclusion, unconscious bias and  inclusive leadership training to 1500 leaders to improve decision making through greater inclusive leadership knowledge & skill.

Fiona drove a stronger national approach to Guiding working with 7 State Girl Guiding organisations to transform Australian Guiding to build a sustainable 21st century organisation by focussing on increasing membership,improving financial sustainability and reinvigoration of the brand. Fiona managed the Australian Centenary Year of the Girl Guide delivering positive outcomes for 30,000 Guiding members, government, and corporate and not for profit strategic partners and the Australian community.

jobs.jobTitle: Executive Head of Advancement of Women & Diversity
jobs.description: At ANZ, Fiona developed an award winning diversity program, establishing the norms for an inclusive workplace that fueled high performance.  Her work included developing and implementing integrated  diversity and inclusion strategies that leveraged HR and business strategy and delivered tangible business outcomes for ANZ customers and a more inclusive workplace for women, mature age employees, indigenous employees, employees from a range of cultural backgrounds, people with disabilities, employees of all sexual orientations and employees seeking flexibility and lifestyle choice.

Fiona managed the foundation's transition from a charity to a consumer health non government organisation to increase the foundation's external profile, managed complex stakeholder relationships with other State Asthma Foundations, State and Federal governments, private sector partners and asthma researchers.  She also developed a sustainable funding base.

At EOWA Fiona was the founder of the "EOWA Business Achievement Awards", The "EOWA Employer of Choice for Women Citation and the Australian Women in Leadership Census.

At Westpac Fiona led and managed the development and implementation of Westpac's "leading edge" national diversity strategy working with Human Resources, Executives and Line Managers to deliver contemporary employment practices, increased  leadership capability and a more inclusive workplace culture to support 30,000 bank employees that resulted in positive outcomes for  employees and Westpac winning external awards in gender diversity, flexibility and work & family and disability employment.

general.description:
Frazer Jones is one of the world's most distinctive Human Resources recruitment brands, with offices in London, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, Milan, Dubai, Singapore, Hong Kong, Melbourne, Sydney and New York. We are one of the five specialist recruitment businesses within The SR Group,  which is a professional, specialist recruitment organisation that includes Frazer Jones (HR), Taylor Root (Legal & Compliance), Brewer Morris (Tax), Carter Murray (Marketing) and SR Search (Legal Search).

I am a Senior Recruitment Professional with 15 years recruitment experience. general.headline: Diversity, Inclusion and Equity Practitioner
general.description:
Roman Ruzbacky is an experienced diversity and inclusion manager, practitioner and former analytical chemist. He has worked extensively in the design and implementation of diversity and inclusion frameworks and strategies that have resulted in positive commercial and cultural outcomes.

Utilising a sound evidence base and effective engagement strategies, he has been able to mainstream diversity and inclusion strategies into the organisation’s business and operational plans, instil confidence in leaders to be increasingly competent in diversity practice resulting in significant and equitable outcomes - “Excellence with Equity”.

Roman has developed gender equity, women in STEM, CALD, LGBTIQ, flexibility and disability action plans, completed ten successful WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citations for three organisations, written family and domestic violence policy and designed diversity surveys. Roman is also an experienced facilitator, having conducted EEO and diversity training workshops and has managed over 500 complaints of discrimination, sexual harassment and bullying. 

At the core of the work is the belief that people should be treated with dignity and respect and have the ability to participate in all aspects of work and public life. Diversity and inclusion needs to be a lived and breathed experience. A seasoned and passionate practitioner who delivers results and takes people with him on the journey to raise diversity consciousness and competency. 

Contact: 0438 601 095

general.company: Selection Partners - incorporating Executive Women Shortlists
general.description:
I have fourteen years experience within the Recruitment Industry providing bespoke Executive Solutions. I am the founder of Executive Women Shortlists (EWS)- www.executivews.com.au the only service of its kind in Australia sourcing Executive Women for Senior placements. EWS has an exemption under the Equal Opportunity Act to strategically source talented women for Australian businesses. I have worked hard to build a solid reputation in the business community for quality service and integrity.

I have written articles on women in leadership, effective senior recruiting, hiring people with disabilities, and Sales techniques for various publications and was described as ‘Professional’ in Small Business & Entrepreneur magazine ‘Anthill.’ In 2009 I competed on ‘The Australian Apprentice’ Series One. I often speak on gender issues including at the Financial Inclusion Action Plan launch, The Australian Talent Conference, International Women’s Day events and RU OK day.

In 2010, I was became the Secretary and Public Officer for WIRE- Women's Information. Late 2012 I joined both the Risk and Compliance committee for Australian Quadriplegics Association ( AQA) and took a lead in the CSR committee for ESH Group. 

Community: I have travelled to the red-light slums in Mumbai to raise awareness and money for trafficked women and children. I ran a volunteer job club for Victorian women wanting to renter the workforce. I have led a large clothing drive for disadvantaged women in Victoria and in December 2012 raised money to buy 100 toys that we delivered to an orphanage in Jakarta. In June 13, I travelled to Brazil to work with exploited girls. I am also a weekend foster mother and I am proudly a spokesperson for Mackillop Family Services Awareness Campaign.

My passion is addressing the lack of representation of women in senior levels of business in Australia and I am fortunate enough to live in a country that allows me to pursue my goals.

Amy recruits senior and executive roles and focuses on discreet searches and market mapping for ASX companies with particular interests in STEM, Property and Superannuation.

general.headline: United Nations Association of Australia (Victorian Division)
general.description:
We engage the Victorian community on key issues on the UN agenda such as the Sustainable Development Goals, human rights, gender equality, climate change, global health, humanitarian action, peace and security.

We seek to strengthen global citizenship by educating Victorians about the UN and UN Associations. We work to empower and inspire Australians to take local actions and constructively engage with issues of global concern. 

We work with schools, universities, NGOs, community groups, governments and businesses to raise awareness of the United Nations and its work, and address critical challenges currently facing the international community.

We run a number of ongoing programs and activities in support of the UN and its key priorities including:
Annual UN Day Media Awards
Model UN Conferences for schools, universities and workplaces
Public forums and seminars
Global Goals Academy

For more information, visit www.unaavictoria.org.au

"As a CTT Certified Consultant, I use the tools and resources from Barrett Values Centre to support my clients in their personal, leadership and cultural transformation. The tools define an actionable road map that becomes an integral part of a leader's personal development plan and business strategy.

The tools have been used to measure the values of over 6,000 organisations and 3,000 leaders in 90 countries. They help foster the transformation of corporations, NGOs, government and municipal agencies, communities, schools, and nations. The CTT values assessment instruments are available in over 50 languages.

I believe that organisations, teams, schools, nations, and communities function better when leaders are focused on building values-driven cultures that benefit people and society. I believe that when you measure your culture, you can manage it."

general.headline: CEO and Founder | The Inclusive Foundation
general.description:
On a mission to create a world where everyone is included and valued for their difference, and driven by the desire to assist individuals, teams and organisations to be their best. I am an organisational effectiveness and strategic senior leader that believes in an holistic and integrated approach to business, people, culture and change. While providing an organisation with a comprehensive and easy-to-use roadmap, the aim is to develop an organisational culture with the behaviours and capability to empower both the organisation and the individuals within it, to achieve their goals.

Specialties: Inclusion, enterprise change management and leadership, culture change, strategic planning facilitation, people and talent management, leadership and career development, capability and organisational development, end-to-end learning strategy for behavioural, operational and technical development, and employee engagement programs.

jobs.description:
The Inclusive Foundation is a not-for-profit with the mission of creating a world where everyone is included. Our innovative approach to social impact includes; organisational assessment with an outcome measurement focus; transformation of people, leaders and organisations; collaboration and partnership with governments and agencies; and advocacy and empowerment of the traditionally under-represented and under-employed. 

We are creating a movement of change through the organisations, governments, and institutions individuals interact with on a daily basis, and based on empirical evidence, setting the global benchmark for inclusion. We have thrown away the labels that distinguish the differences between people and only serve to divide us. Rather, our focus is on meeting the specific needs of all people.
 
In a nutshell here are the things we do for our clients:
- Inclusion maturity assessment measured against financial and human capital ROI
- Provide advice on inclusion solutions through our employees from under represented and under employed groups
- Training and certification for D&I professionals or project teams implementing inclusion transformation programs
- Strategic inclusion transformation solutions, planning, and implementation
 
Our goal when working with you is to genuinely make a difference to move you from diversity and awareness to a place of true inclusion. At the same time you are working with a not for profit and supporting us in our mission to drive global social change and create a world where everyone is included.

www.inclusivefoundation.org

www.facebook.com/inclusivefoundation

Annual Aust/NZ Inclusion and Diversity Dialogue “Courageous Conversations”, Trans-Tasman Business Circle - 8 June 2018, Sydney
Courageous Conversation: Why labels are divisive and morning teas don't work

I take a pragmatic approach to organisational transformation that seeks to define the desired future state of an organisation, quantify and qualify current state, and strategically and tactically transform an organisation in a context of constantly evolving internal and external environments.
 
The purpose is to bring about more rapid and complete cultural transformation of an organisation so as to facilitate the achievement of its business objectives. The ultimate goal is to transcend the organisation achieving a normal level of functioning, to empowering ongoing growth and continued actualisation and evolution.

I partner with my clients to create sustainable, and in many cases, evolutionary transformation of teams, departments, and organisations.

2010 Australian Business Award Winner for Service Excellence
2009 Top 50 SmartCompany Crown Lager Business Start Up Award
2009 Australian Institute of Professional Facilitators Strategic Learning Partner of the Year 
2008 Silver for Preferred Career Development and Training Company in Human Capital Magazine’s Top HR Providers

Clients include; Telstra, Sydney Trains, Commonwealth Bank, Bankwest, Coca Cola Amatil, Qantas, QBE Insurance, KPMG, Datacom, Supercheap Auto Group, ANSTO, State Transit Authority, RailCorp, Transfield Services, QGC (a BG Group company), Tabcorp, SAI Global, Campbell Page, Club Plus Superannuation, Sanity and Virgin Music, Event Cinemas, Crown Melbourne, Nine Entertainment Group and many more.

The Business Transformation team; lead and manage enterprise change; provide change management support to the business; and lead business environment improvement initiatives. Examples of deliverables/achievements throughout my engagement are (but not limited to);

•	Developed an enterprise change view of $2bn worth of projects to include change impact, load and activity across the organisation and integrated into executive monthly project discussions.

•	Responsible and accountable for the change assurance for $600m+ investment from Infrastructure NSW for the building of a train network to meet the growing needs of Sydney.

•	Establishment of an enterprise view and managed approach to change activity.

•	Change management integrated in the Executive visual management cell and strategic decision making.

•	Commenced 22 business transformation engagements across the organisation that reaches approximately 45% of the 10,500 workforce.

•	Developed a business environment mapping methodology, linked to the organisation’s vision and values, to turn culture change into a tangible and measurable objective.

•	Designed and implemented practical and fit for purpose change management tools/resources integrated into the project management lifecycle and methodology.

•	Review of the change management consideration in all business cases and PMPs seeking funding approval (capex and opex), and providing feedback and coaching to project teams.

•	Development of the 2013-2015 Sydney Trains People Operations Plan 

•	Bespoke design, implementation and ongoing management of an Employee Pulse Check  (Climate survey) aligned to the organisation’s objectives.  Across three years the response rate has increased from 17% to 71%.

•	Design, management, and facilitation of a 6-month General Manager collaboration program to reduce silos, increase their accountability in business transformation, and increase engagement.

A new role for the organisation, and as part of the Director's team reporting to the CEO, I was responsible for establishing the Talent function across Australia/Asia incorporating the full employee lifecycle including; attraction, recruitment, performance, development, engagement and retention.
Achievements and Deliverables in this short contract role included;
• Development of an integrated talent management strategy and change management plan in line with organisational objectives for Australia Asia.
• Business case approval and requirements definition for implementation of Success Factors; a talent management system to enable the business to apply consistent processes for talent management across the Group.
• Design of a capability framework aligned with corporate vision and values, including a library of coaching advice for managers and development activities.
• Facilitation of organisational redesign, talent review and implementation plans for key geographies.
• Design, development and deployment of a Sharepoint Talent Portal housing resources to support employee and people leaders in their role and career across the full talent management and employee lifecycle.
• Design of a corporate induction plus guidelines for local site induction for consistent on boarding experience.
• Development and leadership of a talent management community of practice across Australia/Asia.
• Business case approval and implementation plan for People and Culture program in partnership with Kenexa.
• Creation of an easily communicated KPI framework aligned to organisational objectives for the financial year.
• Development of a behavioural interview process and interactive interview question form aligned to organisational culture and values.

general.description:
I am an assurance partner in the Sydney office with significant experience in assurance, compliance and advisory services to the financial services industry, specialising in wealth and asset management.  I enjoy drawing on my extensive experience with leading financial services organisations to deliver a robust and pragmatic audit function and bringing valuable insights on the industry, operations and business to my clients.

I am also a compliance specialist and lead our compliance assurance practice, overseeing compliance plan and AFSL audits for financial services organisations  and am a regular presenter on compliance matters at industry forums and participates in policy development submissions of regulators

My advisory experience includes pre and post systems implementation reviews, compliance and risk framework assessments, regulatory action remediation assessments, legal entity rationalisations, capital assessments and industry benchmarking. 

I am passionate about improving diversity and contributing to the community and social issues and am on the Sydney committees for the EY Foundation and NOWW.

jobs.description:
Rita is an assurance partner at EY over 24 years’ experience in assurance, compliance and advisory services, specialising in wealth and asset management.  As an audit engagement partner for leading financial services clients, Rita draws on her extensive experience to deliver a robust and pragmatic audit function and brings valuable insights on the industry, operations and business.

She leads our compliance assurance practice, overseeing compliance plan and AFSL audits for financial services and property management organisations.  Rita was a member of the Australian Auditing Standards Board working parties which developed assurance standards for compliance engagements and AFSL audits. She is a regular presenter on compliance matters at industry forums and participates in policy development submissions of regulators. 

Rita brings significant experience and industry insights from:
•	conducting independent compliance assessments requested by regulators
•	assessing the effectiveness of risk and compliance frameworks and working with management to address areas of concern and  regulatory action remediation
•	working proactively and pragmatically with compliance functions and boards
•	conducting service organisation controls audits and liaising directly with the clients of these service organisations to understand their needs and provide specified assertions and transition assurance services
•	advisory projects tailored to client needs and requests. These include pre and post systems implementation reviews, legal entity rationalisations and capital assessments.
